varients.title: Glacier
varients.text: Using only water types and ice types

varients.title: Earth
varients.text: Using only rock, ground, and grass types

varients.title: Spooky
varients.text: Using only ghost, psychic, dark, and dragon types

varients.title: Normal
varients.text: Using only normal types

varients.title: Light
varients.text: Without using any dark type pokemon, or dark type moves

varients.title: Forest
varients.text: Using only bug, grass, flying and poison types

varients.title: Starter-Type
varients.text: Using only water, fire and grass types

varients.title: Firefighter
varients.text: Don't use any fire type pokemon or moves

varients.title: Itemless
varients.text: Without using any items

varients.title: Berry
varients.text: Only healing with berries

varients.title: Anticapitalist
varients.text: Without buying any items

varients.title: Pokeball
varients.text: Without buying any Great Balls or Ultra Balls

varients.title: Variety
varients.text: Catching every pokemon in a different type of pokeball

varients.title: Unplugged
varients.text: Without using the PC, TMs, or any electric types

varients.title: Empty-Handed
varients.text: Without using held items

varients.title: Flat-tire
varients.text: Without using the bicycle (unless required)

varients.title: Poke-millionaire
varients.text: Game doesn't end until you accrue 1,000,000 pokedollars

varients.title: Basic
varients.text: Using only pokemon that are unevolved

varients.title: Baby
varients.text: Using only pokemon that have a baby evolution

varients.title: Everstone
varients.text: Without evolving any pokemon after you catch them

varients.title: Mega
varients.text: Using only pokemon that have mega evolutions

varients.title: Evolution
varients.text: Using only pokemon that have evolutions

varients.title: Cute
varients.text: Using only pokemon that are cute

varients.title: Friendly
varients.text: Using only pokemon that evolve via friendship

varients.title: Stone
varients.text: Using only pokemon that evolve via evolution stones

varients.title: Ugly
varients.text: Using only pokemon that are ugly

varients.title: Steve
varients.text: Nickname all of your pokemon 'Steve'

varients.title: Hairy
varients.text: Using only pokemon that have hair/fur

varients.title: No-Bidoof
varients.text: You cannot use Bidoof on your team (sad)

varients.title: Tackle
varients.text: All of your pokemon have to know tackle

varients.title: Growl
varients.text: All of your pokemon have to know growl

varients.title: HM
varients.text: Every pokemon has to learn an HM before the pokemon league

varients.title: Slow-mo
varients.text: Play without ever attacking first

varients.title: Sleepy-Head
varients.text: All of your pokemon need to learn moves that cause sleep

varients.title: Unique-Moves
varients.text: None of your pokemon can know the same move as another

varients.title: Challenger
varients.text: Defeat every trainer that is available to challenge

varients.title: Pacifist
varients.text: Only fight required trainers

varients.title: Healthy
varients.text: Release any pokemon that falls below half health

varients.title: No-Poison
varients.text: Release any pokemon that is ever poisoned

varients.title: Insomnia
varients.text: Release any pokemon that ever falls asleep

varients.title: Trader
varients.text: Complete each of the game trades during the playthrough

varients.title: Wonder
varients.text: Wonder trade every pokemon that you catch

varients.title: Static
varients.text: Using only pokemon from the static encounters

varients.title: Shiny
varients.text: Using only shiny pokemon

varients.title: Egg
varients.text: Using only pokemon hatched from eggs

varients.title: Tall-Grass
varients.text: Using only pokemon encountered in tall grass

varients.title: Net
varients.text: Using only pokemon that are obtained in a cave or by fishing

varients.title: Super-Effective
varients.text: Using only super effective moves

varients.title: Not-Effective
varients.text: Without using any super effective moves

varients.title: Status
varients.text: Using only status moves

varients.title: Damaging
varients.text: Without using any status moves

varients.title: STAB
varients.text: Using only STAB moves that are the same type as the user

varients.title: Fast
varients.text: No using moves that require 2 turns or more (bide, fly, etc)

varients.title: Special
varients.text: Using only special attacking moves

varients.title: Physical
varients.text: Using only physical attacking moves

varients.title: Pet
varients.text: Using only dog, cat, hamster and ferret inspired pokemon

varients.title: Reptile
varients.text: Using only reptile, amphibian or dragon inspired pokemon

varients.title: Inanimate
varients.text: Using only pokemon inspired on inanimate objects (rocks, trash, pokeballs, etc.)

varients.title: 2-feet
varients.text: Using only pokemon that walk on 2 feet

varients.title: Tails
varients.text: Using only pokemon that have tails

varients.title: Wings
varients.text: Using only pokemon that have wings

varients.title: Vowel
varients.text: Using only pokemon that start with vowels

varients.title: N-U-Z-L-O-C-K-E
varients.text: Using only pokemon whose name starts with the letter N, U, Z, L, O, C, K, or E

varients.title: Gen-1er
varients.text: Using only pokemon that are from the first generation

varients.title: Odd
varients.text: Using only pokemon with Odd pokedex numbers

varients.title: Long-Name
varients.text: Using only pokemon with 7 or more letters in their name

varients.title: ABCs
varients.text: Each pokemon you catch must start with a different letter

varients.title: Blue
varients.text: Using only pokemon with the color blue on them

varients.title: Green
varients.text: Using only pokemon with the color green on them

varients.title: Yellow
varients.text: Using only pokemon with the color yellow on them

varients.title: Red
varients.text: Using only pokemon with the color red on them

varients.title: Big-Eyes
varients.text: Using only pokemon with big eyes

varients.title: Small
varients.text: Using only pokemon that are shorter than 4 ft tall

varients.title: Heavy
varients.text: Using only pokemon that are heavier than 50kg

varients.title: Small-Party
varients.text: Limit the amount of pokemon you can carry to 4

varients.title: Single
varients.text: Only carrying 1 pokemon at a time

varients.title: Low-Level
varients.text: With a level cap of 3 less than the next gym leader

varients.title: No-Insurance
varients.text: Without ever healing at a Pokecenter

varients.title: Single-Use
varients.text: You can only use each pokemon in 1 gym fight

varients.title: Litter-Bug
varients.text: You can't pick up any (non-required) items from the ground

varients.title: Marathon
varients.text: You must carry your starter for the whole game
